results.title: The Ultimate mystery

results.title: The Ultimate Frank Lloyd Wright (PC)
results.creator_credit: Jeff Hixson, Byron Preiss and Microsoft Corporation
results.brief_description: A stimulating history of Wright’s influential architectural design which gives you insight to his genius as well as an understanding of the influence his architecture has had on subsequant generations of architects. This program allows you to design your own buildings and gain an understanding of the architectural process. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or comp- atible with a 486/33 microprocessor; 4 MB of RAM (8 MB recommended); 500 KB of avaialable hard-disk space; double speed CD-Rom drive; super VGA display; MS DOS operating system (version 3.1 or later); Microsoft Windows version 3.1 or later; MPC-compatible sound card; Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device.

results.title: The Ugly Duckling (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Walt Disney introduces Danish story teller, Hans Christian Anderson, and presents an animated illustration of the writer’s life, from his humble beginnings as the son of a shoemaker and washer-woman, to his rise to international fame as a writer. This program also includes the well-known story of the Ugly Duckling.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Egon Schmidt, Paul Hammerich and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: This animated motion picture maintains all the wisdom, with and compassion of Hans Christian Anderson’s tale. The graceful delicate images and music evoke the sadness and ultimate joy of the sensitive duckling whose only fault is that he is different. The universal theme of alienation, prejudice and true beauty are subtly expressed in the film.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.creator_credit: Kazuhiko Watanabe, H.C. Andersen, Masaji Hara, Matsue Jimbo, Shigeki Ishikawa and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: Using toy like models of animals and birds, this film tells Hans Christian Anderson’s story of the hardships undergone by an ugly duckling until he finds himself a beautiful swan.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. The well-known Hans Christian Anderson fairy tale of the ugly baby duck that turned out to be a beautiful swan when it grew up is retold with live animals. Filmed in Europe, real ducks, chickens, geese and swans are pictured against authentic background settings.

results.title: The Typewriter, the rifle and the movie camera
results.creator_credit: Adam Simon, Colin MacCabe, Paula Jalfon, BFI, Channel Four, Havoc Inc, Independent Film Channel and Museum of Modern Art (New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary about Sam Fuller, of one of Hollywood’s most illustrious writers and directors. Tim Robbins and director Adam Simon travelled to Paris, where Fuller resided for thirteen years until the mid nineties, to interview him. Through conversations with Fuller the film explores his biographical and stylistic roots and examines the three primary phases of his professional life as a newspaperman, a soldier and as a filmmaker. Observations from Jim Jarmusch, Martin Scorsese and Quentin Tarantino and extracts from Fuller’s films reveal an extraordinary portrait of one of Hollywood’s true mavericks.

results.title: The Two faces of Japan
results.brief_description: A documentary of social, political and economic life in Japan today. Interviews the Japanese Prime Minister, Mr Ikeda and the late Leader of the Opposition, who was tragically assassinated a few days later. Gives insight into the conflicting influences of East and West in studies of the daily lives of four typical Japanese - a fashion model, a university student, a skilled worker in the Kobe Kawasaka Dockyard, and an Osaka suburban housewife.
